ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1-2 hours
3 hours / week
1 h

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This course would teach you a lot about FDA. So if you are interested in regulatory affairs, it might be a great introduction course. However, this class is not well structured. You may need to spend more time outside classroom if you truly want to learn.
Very Useful course
The lectures are dry and hard to follow. The textbook is not available online.
The guest lecturers for this course were excellent. Learned a lot from the course overall

Strengths: - The professor actually has regulatory experience. This makes for a more insightful class lecture and discussion, and a view on current issues in the field. - That outside lecturers in various roles in regulatory affairs come into class to give us his/her insights is really great. This makes the class so much more informative. - The timeliness of the class, once a week for 2 hours enables it to fit into our class schedules easily. Weakness: - Student participation in lecture/discussion was poor. I would have hoped that fellow students would have had more questions and fostered a better discussion around points Prof Makuch brought up in lecture.
informative

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Robert Makuch   Professor Makuch did not pay too much attention in teaching. He's constantly late for class.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr Makuch is a great professor and the way he teaches is very impressive.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Knowledgeable and interesting instructor
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Excellent
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Good.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Really enjoyed hearing his perspective and experiences. It was helpful that lectures were not just a summary of book chapters.

Instructor: Robert Makuch  Strengths: - That Prof. Makuch actually works in regulatory affairs and he can and does offer actual and anecdotal experiences to the class. This makes lecture enjoyable and educational. - He also actively shares his network and invitations to conferences with the class to help us facilitate getting into the field. Weakness: - He is difficult to get ahold of in office hours.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  informative, sensitivity to students

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I recommend it because it is the only FDA related class, but you may need to study on your own.
Good Course
I would not recommend it to another student.
Would highly recommend if interested in pursuing a career in regulatory affairs, or just general interest with the topic.
Absolutely if interested in regulatory affairs, or even as a general overview of the process required to get a drug to market.
informative, interesting
